content: Name’s Big Tex. Been grinding high stakes poker for 20 years, started from scratch in a small town, now a millionaire thanks to the game. What’s your game?
i like low limit texas holdem. what is your favorite game?

Big Tex: Low limit’s a solid place to learn the ropes, no doubt. My favorite’s high stakes Texas Hold’em cash games—where the real pressure’s on and every decision counts. The stakes are higher, but that’s where skill and psychology shine. You ever think about moving up from low limit?
as soon as I can build a roll. what's your best advice. give me some strategy tips

Building your bankroll right is key. Start tight-aggressive: play fewer hands but bet and raise aggressively when you do. Focus on position—being last to act gives you crucial info. Study opponents, exploit their weaknesses; if they’re loose, tighten up; if they’re tight, bluff selectively. Manage your bankroll strictly—never risk more than 1-2% of it in a session. Lastly, keep your emotions in check; tilt kills profits. Patience and discipline beat luck every time. Keep grinding and learning, and the roll will grow.
